id.description: Title for messages
Begin Prompt message.
Value can be "yes" or "no". Default value is "yes".
Command for executing. Default value is "setup.exe". Substring %%T will be replaced with path to temporary folder, where files were extracted.
Directory prefix for "RunProgram". Default value is ".\\".
Name of file for executing.
Parameters for "ExecuteFile".
Execution command (multiple instances are allowed). There are two modes: the usual "RunProgram" or "ExecuteFile" mode, and automated "AutoInstall" mode.
Execution command, where X is the scenario number (from 0 to 9) you wish to complete. You can have up to 10 scenarios for automated installations.
Deletes the specified file or folder AFTER the installation.
The path to the "RunProgram" execution folder (do not confuse with the current folder).
Execution command.
Parameters for "ExecuteFile". This is an optional parameter. You use it whenever you need to pass a parameter to "ExecuteFile" via the command line.
Sets the extraction path. The extraction folder will not be deleted after the extraction.
0, 1 or 2: 0 - overwrite all files (default mode); 1 - do not overwrite the existing files; 2 - overwrite only the older files;
Execution command (multiple instances are allowed).
="1"; Deletes the SFX when the process is over.
Environment variable creation command (multiple instances are allowed).
Shortcut creation command (multiple instances are allowed).
Specifies the MINIMUM extraction dialog window width, where "x" is the window width in pixels.
Specifies the MINIMUM width for the extraction path dialog windows (stand-alone "ExtractPath" and combined "BeginPrompt" + "ExtractPath"), where "x" is the window width in pixels.
A set of flags for changing the extraction dialog appearance, where "x" is a sum of the numeric values or a summation expression like "2+4+128+1024".

1 or 2: 1 - shows the extraction process, but hides the "Cancel" button and disables the "Close" button (in the window title bar) and [ESC] key on the keyboard; 2 - hides the extraction dialog completely (silent mode);
"yes" or "no" Progress="no" is an equivalent to GUIMode="2".
Changes the default title.
Displays a message in a dialog window when SFX is launched.
The text above the editable extraction path field.
Changes the extraction path dialog window title.
Changes the extraction dialog window title.
Displays the specified text ABOVE the extraction progress indicator (Progress Bar).
Changes the button text in the extraction dialog window from "Cancel" (default) to the specified one.
Displays a dialog window with the text of your choice.
The error window title.
After finishing all operations (extraction, program execution, file deletion, shortcut creation, etc) a dialog window with "FinishMessage" text is displayed.
Lets you specify the help text that can be displayed by invoking the SFX archive with "-h" or "-?" switches.
